Package fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models

HIOA DEVS simulation models.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractAtomicHIOA_Factory
    The class AbstractAtomicHIOA_Factory implements the basic functionalities of atomic HIOA factories.
    AbstractCoupledHIOA_Factory
    The class AbstractCoupedHIOAFactory defines the shared behaviours among coupled HIOA factories.
    AtomicHIOA
    The abstract class AtomicHIOA implements the base level hybrid input/output automata, having imported, internal and exported variables as well as events which implementation is based on and inherited from DEVS atomic models.
    AtomicHIOAwithDE
    The class AtomicHIOAwithDE implements hybrid input/output automata where the trajectories of continuous variables are defined by differential equations.
    AtomicHIOAwithEquations
    The class AtomicHIOAwithEquations implements hybrid input/output automata where the trajectories of continuous variables are defined by algebraic equations.
    StandardAtomicHIOA_Factory
    The class StandardAtomicHIOA_Factory defines a basic factory used when the instantiation protocol of an atomic HIOA model class does not modify the one defined in the class AtomicHIOA.
    StandardCoupledHIOA_Factory
    The class StandardCoupledHIOA_Factory implements a standard model factory for coupled HIOA models.
    StandardRTAtomicHIOA_Factory
    The class StandardRTAtomicHIOA_Factory defines a basic factory used when the instantiation protocol of a real time atomic HIOA model class does not modify the one defined in the class AtomicHIOA.
    StandardRTCoupledHIOA_Factory
    The class StandardRTCoupledHIOA_Factory implements a standard model factory for real time coupled HIOA models.

Package fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models Description

HIOA DEVS simulation models.

Licence

Copyright Jacques Malenfant, Sorbonne Universite.

Jacques.Malenfant@lip6.fr

This software is a computer program whose purpose is to provide a new implementation of the DEVS simulation standard for Java.

This software is governed by the CeCILL-C license under French law and abiding by the rules of distribution of free software. You can use, modify and/ or redistribute the software under the terms of the CeCILL-C license as circulated by CEA, CNRS and INRIA at the following URL http://www.cecill.info.

As a counterpart to the access to the source code and rights to copy, modify and redistribute granted by the license, users are provided only with a limited warranty and the software's author, the holder of the economic rights, and the successive licensors have only limited liability.

In this respect, the user's attention is drawn to the risks associated with loading, using, modifying and/or developing or reproducing the software by the user in light of its specific status of free software, that may mean that it is complicated to manipulate, and that also therefore means that it is reserved for developers and experienced professionals having in-depth computer knowledge. Users are therefore encouraged to load and test the software's suitability as regards their requirements in conditions enabling the security of their systems and/or data to be ensured and, more generally, to use and operate it in the same conditions as regards security.

The fact that you are presently reading this means that you have had knowledge of the CeCILL-C license and that you accept its terms.

This package defines the interfaces and abstract classes implementing the core behaviour of HIOA DEVS models. It also defines the factories used in simulation architecture descriptions to instantiate models when required. HIOA models that obey the standard instantiation protocols (constructors with the same parameters) defined by the classes in this package do not need to use factories. The composition process can use model classes directly for instantiation rather than factories in this case.
